estrangement.definition: a period when you are estranged from someone (= no longer friendly with them), or the fact of no longer being friendly
estrangement.example: their reunion followed a long estrangement

ostentatious.definition: characterized by pretentious or showy display; designed to impress
ostentatious.example: a simple design that is glamorous without being ostentatious

exultant.definition: filled with or expressing great joy or triumph

meticulous.definition: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
meticulous.example: the designs are hand-glazed with meticulous care

invigorating.definition: making one feel strong, healthy, and full of energy

disconsolate.definition: very unhappy and unable to be comforted

surreptitously.definition: secretly, without anyone seeing or knowing
surreptitously.example: Joe surreptitiously had a look in the answer book

brusquely.definition: in a way that is quick and slightly rude
brusquely.example: The vender brusquely elbowed me aside to talk to the next customer

extricate.definition: free (someone or something) from a constraint or difficulty
extricate.example: he was trying to extricate himself from official duties

sanctimonious.definition: making a show of being morally superior to other people.
sanctimonious.example: what happened to all the sanctimonious talk about putting his family first?

protracted.definition: lasting for a long time or longer than expected or usual

disparagingly.definition: in a critical or unkind way that shows you do not respect someone or something
disparagingly.example: she denied they had a relationship but she never spoke disparagingly of him

crestfallen.example: he came back empty-handed and crestfallen

exuberant.definition: full of energy, excitement, and cheerfulness.
exuberant.example: a noisy bunch of exuberant youngsters

sepulchral.definition: relating to a tomb or interment
